intro: Manettia gracilis var. glabra, commonly known as the smooth manettia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, elliptical leaves that are smooth and glossy. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, with five petals and a tubular corolla. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in rainforests or along stream banks.
